summary: This bill directs the Secretary of Housing and Urban Development and the Director of the Bureau of the Census to conduct a study on how federal agencies identify and record housing loss in the United States. The study will define different types of housing loss (eviction, foreclosure, disaster displacement), identify relevant data sets, assess their accuracy, and recommend improvements for data collection and recording. A report with findings and recommendations must be submitted to relevant congressional committees within six months of the bill's enactment.
